text: hi all, we are creating HubSpot tickets using golang, but while creating ticket we would like to upload image(png) but I am not able to find go lang code for the same . Please help me any code in go lang for file upload.

Hey everyone, I have a blog setup with isotope filtering... but am trying to also include infinite scroll at the same time. Not having any luck. Anyone here that has successfully done this that could provide some insights? Thanks!
Willing to pay if someone was able to help or just do a pretty quick implementation.

Hey folks,

I'm trying to configure SSO
I tried to follow this docs <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/set-up-single-sign-on-sso-to-access-private-content#set-up-sso-for-a-saml-based-application>

Maybe I'm wrong for my approach,
My approach is as following:
I need to have a private page let's say `<http://knowledge.mydomain.com|knowledge.mydomain.com>` and this page should be only accessible to loggedin users to my system
If there were no authentication, then I'll redirect him to SSO page to add his credentials and then redirect him back to the `<http://knowledge.mydomain.com|knowledge.mydomain.com>`



but my problems is:
I'm trying to configure it with my rails application
I tried to follow this guidelines here:
<https://ossoapp.com/blog/saml-sso-rails/>

but I'm stuck in the redirection, the HubSpot should send a request with SAMLRequest query parameter, then I'll decode this SAMLRequest params.

then my question is, after decode this, How I'll validate the user? where the user will add his email?

what I believe is:
I should have a login page (username + password) then when click login, I'll send to my rails application (SAMLRequest + username + password)
in my backend code, I'll validate the username and password, but what is the use for SAMLRequest in this case?

Any support please?

Regards

Hello everyone!
There is an error on login:

```We don't need that code right now
Your account doesn't require a log in code right now. Please click below to return to log in and try again.```
What can it cause and how to get rid of it?
How are you implementing the infinite scroll?

Hey everyone. Quick CTA question. When creating a CTA button, either on page in a hero module, or on the call-to-action page, selecting redirect type 'HubSpot page or blog post', no pages show in the drop down to link to. I have several other pages created (all in draft) but none are accessible. Any help would be appreciated greatly!

Are you loading all of the posts on page load and hiding them or grabbing them in batches as the user scrolls?

I’ve never used Isotope but based off of my understanding of it it relies on classnames to do the filtering. Which means that it will only filter through items that are already on the page.

So if youre loading them in as the user scrolls via ajax or fetch you will need to re-fetch the blog posts with the correct filter that was assigned on click.

It may be easier to load them all via hubl to start with and do a “fake infinite scroll” — hide them and reveal them as the user scrolls down page. That way they are all there and ready for Isotope to do their thing.

<@UQWGKUEN7> Thanks! Yeah, loading all of the posts. I ended up using a load more but hiding the button and triggering a click on scroll. All posts are loaded, but hidden until triggered to display. Got it! :slightly_smiling_face:
